Cell-mediated immunity is a type of adaptive immune response that involves the activation of T-cells, which recognize and respond to specific antigens. This type of response is also known as delayed-type hypersensitivity (DTH).

The four types of hypersensitivity reactions are:

* Type I: Immediate hypersensitivity (allergic reactions, e.g. anaphylaxis)
* Type II: Antibody-mediated hypersensitivity (e.g. autoimmune disorders, such as rheumatoid arthritis)
